snippet: In countries like Slovakia and Hungary, vigilante groups are portraying a menacing incursion of asylum seekers to build support for their xenophobic agendas.
abstract: Vigilante groups in Slovakia, Hungary and Bulgaria are patrolling borders, streets and other public areas to defend against what they see as menacing incursion of asylum seekers, many of them Muslims from Afghanistan, Iraq, Syria and other poor, war-torn nations; authorities are worried about continuing presence of such groups even as flow of refugees through many of these countries has all but stopped.

byline.original: By MIROSLAVA GERMANOVA, BORYANA DZHAMBAZOVA and HELENE BIENVENU
byline.contributor: Miroslava Germanova reported from Bratislava; Boryana Dzhambazova from Sofia, Bulgaria; and Helene Bienvenu from Budapest.

lead_paragraph: In countries like Slovakia and Hungary, vigilante groups are portraying a menacing incursion of asylum seekers to build support for their xenophobic agendas.

headline.main: Vigilantes Patrol Parts of Europe Where Few Migrants Set Foot
headline.print_headline: Vigilantes Patrol Where Few Migrants Set Foot

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Middle East and Africa Migrant Crisis
